intro: Enodium caeruleum subsp. atrovirens, commonly known as the dark green spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, dark green leaves and yellow flowers. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. The plant features a branched stem with milky sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a waxy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. This subspecies is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
